activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#12634
activity.text:
@rithviknishad @Jacobjeevan i would like to work on this issue.

**My Approach**

In the handleAddAllergy function in AllergyQuestion.tsx, we're creating a new allergy with ALLERGY_INITIAL_VALUE, but this initial value doesn't include the note field. So including the note field during the creation of a new allergy should fix this issue

End Date: EOD after assignment

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#12621
activity.text:
@rithviknishad @Jacobjeevan I would like to work on this issues

**My approach**
 The current implementation considers a note to exist if notes.length > 0, which means even spaces are counted as valid notes.  Modifying the validation to trim the string before checking its length should fix this issue.

End Date: EOD after assignment

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#12411
activity.text: Following @Jacobjeevan's suggestion, I've made some UI changes. Hopefully, this was what he was talking about in slack. Since the html-to-image library captures the current state of an element, I believe this is the most practical solution. While it did require some UI adjustments, the generated PNGs are now visually consistent across devices. The resolution may still vary because the library captures the current rendered state, but this shouldn't be a major concern. If there's a better approach or if these changes need adjustment, please let me know

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#12346
activity.text:
>  Date Input Scroll Behavior: The date input field supports mouse-wheel incrementing, but scrolling over it unintentionally scrolls the entire page instead of changing the date.
   Issue: Wheel events are not captured properly, making the feature unusable.
Pincode Input Risks/: The pincode input allows mouse-wheel increment/decrement, which can accidentally alter values (e.g., changing 123456 to 123457).
Risk: Could lead to incorrect data entry.
Additional Issue: No character limit enforced for the pincode field.

How about these problems?

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#11946
activity.text:
## Solution
If we could make the `dosagedialog` component from `/care_fe/src/components/Questionnaire/QuestionTypes/MedicationRequestQuestion.tsx` be aware of the keyboard and make it readjust itself when the Keyboard pops up, I believe this bug could be fixed.

## Expected Timeline
1 or 2 days
